There are always fun activities going on in Japan in relation to the 
Shins=
engumi and it is totally necessary to watch their messageboards 
and blogs =
because frequently they will post things you will not find 
even if you buy=
 every single book on the Shinsengumi.  Often these 
fans will network exte=
nsively and speak to people who work at museums 
or with local Shinsengumi =
"officials" (fans who've spent years 
specializing in certain fields).

A l=
ist is here
http://www.shinsengumihq.com/links.htm

If you nifty their boar=
ds/blogs you'll get alot of neat info...however 
not all info can be verifi=
ed...you have to ask yourself...so where did 
they hear this or what book i=
s this from, who did they speak to and so 
forth. If they don't mention a b=
ook or page number, there information 
is not repeated on http://www.shinse=
ngumihq.com  ... only a few of us 
knows Japanese or have access to reliabl=
e human translators, if we 
post everything we find without double checking=
 chances are we are 
hurting Shinsengumi research in the long run.  

[KOND=
OU's "GRAVE" IN AIZU]
[source:  http://8614.teacup.com/hijikata/bbs]
[trans=
lator:  http://www.nifty.com/globalgate]
message 4/25 (anniversary of Kondo=
u's execution)
***there is alot of confusion over the remains of Kondou Isa=
mi
for example, was his head buried there? or was just his hair? and so 
on=
 and so forth
In the post, the origins of Kondou's grave is discussed, and =
how it at 
one point faced TAMA (Kondou's birthplace/hometown).  
The grave=
 was moved a couple of times and it has been at the current 
location for 3=
9 years.

[MUSEUM WEBSITE]
http://satoshinsen.gozaru.jp/index.html 
In conn=
ection to this website, fans have mentioned that Hijikata's 
pistol is on d=
isplay there (Hijikata's name is to the left):
http://satoshinsen.gozaru.jp=
/s_0004.html

[SHINSENGUMI PETS]
look very very carefully....
http://www3.k=
itanet.ne.jp/~ichiba/honjin/06shinsen/poster-1.html

[THE AIZU CONNECTION]
=
This is the messageboard for the Aizu Shinsengumi Club, as you can 
imagine=
 they are pretty interested in Saitou Hajime.

http://www.aizukanko.com/cgi=
/spict/smallpict.cgi

On the page you will find
1) discussion of the number=
 of war dead buried at Amida Temple (Fujita 
Goro and Tokio's ashes are int=
erred at this temple) and how it was 
very sad that the bodies were exposed=
 to the elements before the 
Imperial Army allowed locals to bury them all
=
2) the possible location of Shinoda Yaso's family's mansion in Aizu
Shinoda=
 Yaso was Saitou Hajime's first wife

[COSPLAY UPDATES]
http://www.shoeikai=
.net/shinsen/06/photo-1.html

 but now it is working again

l_art/wall_art_1_02.htm

old pic of the hot springs/hotel in Aizu (fans sti=
ll seem pretty 
excited about this mural)

seum/wall_art/wall_art_4.htm

This is pretty neat...
http://www.akira.art-t=
v.jp/web/art_museum/trick_art/trick_2_02.htm

I swear that looks like a gig=
antic portrait of the director of the 
hino-shinsengumi club...
http://www.=
akira.art-tv.jp/web/art_museum/shop_art/shop_art_2.htm

[SHQ NEEDS HELP]
Is=
 there anyone here who is fluent in FRENCH who can translate these 
paragra=
phs?  http://www.shinsengumihq.com/Infosheettrans.htm
Ang again, there shou=
ld be tons of info on the French involvement in 
the Bakumatsu which would =
be totally relevant in the Hakodate theatre--
-which means Hijikata's last =
stand in Hokkaido.

We always take contributions of fanart, cosplay pics an=
d whatever you 
have to offer.  Fanart can be 3 dimensional...just take pic=
s from 
different angles.
